summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex Conlon and an unnamed individual regarding scheduling a meeting with a female witness (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses logistical arrangements, note-taking during witness conversations, and previews that upcoming discussions will cover difficult topics including Epstein's conduct with a specific individual.

persons.name: Alex Conlon
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is coordinating the investigation interview schedule and discussing procedural matters regarding witness interactions.

persons.name: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be part of the legal team involved in the investigation coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject whose conduct will be discussed in upcoming meetings with a witness, specifically regarding his actions with another individual.

connections.description: Both are legal professionals copied on the same email discussing investigation logistics, indicating they are part of the same legal team or coordinating on the case.
Conlon is an Assistant U.S. Attorney investigating Epstein's conduct, as indicated by the reference to discussing 'Epstein's conduct' in upcoming meetings.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Interview Scheduling
events.description: Planning for a meeting with a female witness to discuss the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, with topics to include 'Giglio subjects' and Epstein's conduct with a specific individual.

events.title: Previous Coordination Call
events.description: Reference to a conversation the previous week about having someone from the law firm take notes during witness conversations and informing individuals that the SDNY office wants to speak with them.

locations: 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 7110, New York, New York (Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP office)
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was actively scheduling witness interviews as of May 2019, with plans to cover difficult topics including 'Giglio subjects' and Epstein's conduct with a specific individual.
Prosecutors anticipated requesting copies of notes taken during witness conversations and acknowledged that note-takers could become potential witnesses.
The email references an unnamed female witness (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) who was making phone calls to contact two individuals on behalf of the investigation.
The investigation aimed to complete an initial set of discussions before June 2019 due to scheduling concerns.
The correspondence shows coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex Conlon and private law firm Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP in the investigation process.
